intro: Eumorphia sericea subsp. robustior, commonly known as the robust sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. This subspecies is often found in coastal and inland regions where it plays a role in stabilizing dunes and preventing erosion.
